business.headline: Sensex, Nifty tumble ahead of US elections; Hero MotoCorp falls 4%The NSE Nifty 50 dropped by 321.20 points to settle at 23,983.15, while the BSE Sensex fell 941.88 points to 78,782.24. Most of the broader market indices also declined sharply during the session.

Reliance Jio IPO likely in 2025, retail arm to debut much later: Report Reliance Jio IPO: The company is targeting a 2025 listing for Jio, although the retail unit's IPO is expected to follow later due to internal operational priorities.

Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris: How US elections may impact Indian stock marketWith the US election just a day away, Indian markets prepare for shifts across sectors from tech to oil. What could this high-stakes race mean for investors on Dalal Street?

Stock market crash: Adani Ports, Reliance, Bajaj Auto among top losers Market crash: The bloodbath on Dalal Street can be attributed to a combination of factors, including a disappointing Q2 earnings season, heightened caution ahead of the upcoming US presidential elections, and persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).
US presidential elections cause market turbulence as investors grow waryThe US elections are affecting the share market, with significant impacts on bond yields and investor caution.

Panic grips Dalal Street: 4 factors behind today's stock market crashStock market today: Both benchmark indices fell as much as 2%, leading to massive losses for investors. At 12:57 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,303.19 points at 78,420.93, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 437.15 points to trade at 23,867.20.

Niva Bupa Health IPO: Check price band, GMP, lot size, key dates and other detailsNiva Bupa Health IPO: The shares of Niva Bupa Health Insurance are expected to list on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on November 14, 2024.

Swiggy IPO: Check GMP, price band, lot size, dates and other key detailsSwiggy's upcoming IPO promises to be a game-changer in the food delivery market. Read on to know about the key details and what this debut could mean for the future of online delivery in India.

Explained: Why Azad Engineering share price jumped 14% despite market selloffAzad Engineering stock price: Around 12:15 pm, the shares were up 9.49% at Rs 1,599.70, giving Azad Engineering a market capitalization of Rs 9,450 crore.

Bajaj Auto share price falls over 5% today. Should you buy?Bajaj Auto share price declined sharply during Monday's trading session. Is it a good opportunity to buy the stock? Here is all you need to know.

Stock market crash: Sensex drops 1,400 points, here's how much investors lostStock market crash: Concerns mounted amid a volatile market environment driven by uncertainties surrounding the upcoming US presidential election and the Federal Reserve's potential interest rate decisions.

Afcons Infrastructure makes weak stock market debut: Sell or hold?Afcons Infrastructure IPO listing: The company's weak debut on Dalal Street has got investors wondering whether they should exit now or wait for long-term gains. Here is all you need to konw

Sensex crashes 1,100 points today: What's behind the bloodbath on D-StreetStock market crash: Sensex has declined over 1,100 points and the Nifty50 tumbled nearly 400 points in early trade. Read on to know about the factors responsible for today's bloodbath on Dalal Street.

Sensex falls over 1,000 points as foreign outflows continue; Bajaj Auto dips 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,045 points at 78,678.96 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 342.35 points to trade at 23,962.

Gold, silver price today, November 4, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today November 4, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Explained: How Adani Power's supply cut impacts crisis-hit Bangladesh economyAdani Power's supply cut to Bangladesh intensifies existing economic challenges, raising concerns about energy security and financial stability.

Adani Power cuts half of Bangladesh electricity supply over unpaid duesThe power reduction comes at a challenging time for Bangladesh, which reported a shortfall of over 1,600 megawatts (MW) overnight. The 1,496 MW Adani plant is currently generating just 700 MW from one of its two units.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Markets end on strong note; all sectoral indices in greenMuhurat Trading 2024 has concluded, marking the arrival of Samvat 2081. The session, which took place from 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM, ended on a strong note, with the Sensex surging 335 points and the Nifty closing at 24,300. Investors actively participated, reflecting the festive spirit of the Hindu New Year through token investments aimed at attracting prosperity. All the sectoral indices ended the session in green, with M&M, ONGC, Adani Ports and BEL emerging as the top gainers. On the other hand, the top losers were Dr Reddy's, HCLTech, Britannia, Tech Mahindra and Adani Enterprises.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Check timings, stock recommendations, all key detailsMuhurat Trading today: The pre-opening session will begin at 5:45 PM, and all intraday positions will be automatically squared off 15 minutes before the session's close, necessitating careful planning for same-day trades.

Muhurat trading 2024: Check stock picks, trading strategy and expert insightsMuhurat trading is not just a unique market session; it's a cherished tradition where investors make token investments to invoke the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM slams Canada Hindu temple attack, cowardly attempt to intimidate diplomatsPM Modi strongly reacted to the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada's Brampton and called on the Canadian government to ensure justice and uphold the rule of law.

Devendra Fadnavis says 'no musical chair' for chief minister's post in MahayutiSpeaking to India Today TV, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said the Mahayuti alliance already has a policy in place for choosing the next chief minister, adding that "no musical chair" will take place for the same.

Canadian cop suspended for attending pro-Khalistan protest outside Hindu templeHarinder Sohi, a Sergeant of the Peel Regional Police, was suspended by authorities after a video of him participating in a pro-Khalistan protest outside a Hindu temple in Brampton went viral on social media.

Pawan Kalyan condemns Canada temple attack, seeks global support for HindusJana Sena Party chief Pawan Kalyan condemned the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada, calling out the international community to acknowledge and address the suffering of Hindus across the world.

Video: MiG-29 fighter jet spins out of control moments before crash near AgraIn a viral video, some onlookers see the MiG-29 fighter jet of the Indian Air Force falling fast in a flat spin before it hit the ground and burst into flames near Agra. The pilot survived after he ejected himself to safety.

Rohit Sharma should not captain if he misses 2 Tests in AUS: GavaskarFormer India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that India should not keep Rohit Sharma the captain for the Australia tour in case he misses 2 or more Test matches. Gavaskar said that instead of Rohit, Jasprit Bumrah should be made the India captain for the entire series.

Canadian politicians don't have backbone: Ex-minister on Hindu temple attackSpeaking to India Today TV, Ujjal Dosanjh called out the politicians, including Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, for "absolute cowardice" on their part to not call out Khalistanis while condemning the attack on Hindu temples.

Bid to trample Bangladesh Hindu protests: Monk charged with seditionChinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, a Hindu monk and one of the 18 people facing sedition charges in Bangladesh, told India Today Digital that the case was an attempt to finish off the leadership spearheading the protests for minority rights. He said Monday was the deadline for the withdrawal of the sedition case.

How Indian women in US outdo men in their love for Kamala HarrisIn the US, six out of 10 Indian-American voters said that they intended to vote for Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. But there is a gender gap when it comes to Indians supporting Harris. While 67% of Indian-American women intend to vote for her, the percentage of men planning to vote for her is lower at 53%.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Bengaluru man dies after friends dare him to sit on box of firecrackersPolice said that Shabarish was unemployed and accepted the challenge while hoping for a better future with the autorickshaw that was promised to him by his friends.

Watch: Locals rush to help MiG-29 pilot who ejected minutes before crash in AgraVisuals show the MiG-29 aircraft wreckage engulfed in flames, sending thick plumes of smoke into the air. The crash site soon attracted a large crowd of onlookers, with many recording the scene on their devices.
Thailand grants indefinite visa-free entry for Indian travellersVisa-free travel allows tourists to enter a country without needing to obtain a visa either prior to or upon arrival.

Harris different than Hillary Clinton: Indian-American Congressman explains whyUS Vice-President and Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris is ahead in national polls and has the support of a large number of American women, Indian-American Congressman Shri Thanedar said.

Zomato CEO reacts to 'future dated' mushrooms found in Hyderabad warehouseZomato CEO Deepinder Goyal reacted to the concerns raised after "future-dated" button mushrooms were found in the company's Hyderabad warehouse of its B2B platform, Zomato Hyperpure.

Siddaramaiah summoned in land scam case by Lokayukta on November 6Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has been summoned by the Lokayukta in connection with the alleged Muda land scam. He will be questioned on November 6.

Maharashtra polls and the falling Muslim MLA count: Will 2024 be any different?Their declining numbers in the legislative assembly are being blamed on altered social realities where the transfer of votes to minority community candidates has become tough
Chinese spacecraft makes fiery re-entry into Earth, breaks apartDespite this intense descent, the crew landed safely in the Dongfeng area near Jiuquan Spaceport.

PM slams Opposition over sexist remark against Shaina NC: Filthy language usedAmid backlash over the sexist remark by Shiv Sena (UBT)'s Arvind Sawant against Shaina NC of Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena, PM Narendra Modi slammed the Opposition, accusing it of using filthy language on women leaders.

Is air pollution making you fat? Understanding the hidden impactThe annual rise in air pollution post-Diwali is not only affecting respiratory and cardiovascular health but it is also being linked to increasing obesity rates.

Cracker ban was hardly implemented: Supreme Court in notice to Delhi top copThe Supreme Court has asked the Delhi Police Commissioner to submit an affidavit on steps taken by police to ensure a complete firecrackers ban within a week.

Batenge to katenge echoes in Canada after temple attack'Batenge to katenge', a slogan urging Hindus to unite, is now echoing in Canada. The priest of the Brampton temple, where a pro-Khalistani mob attacked devotees, has used the slogan to ask Hindus to forgo differences and stand united. The slogan was popularised by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath.

Expect clamour for new-look team if Kohli, Rohit fail in Australia: GavaskarSpeaking to India Today, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar said there will be clamour for wholesale changes in the Test side if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli fail to return to form in Australia. Rohit and Kohli failed miserably in India's shocking 0-3 loss to New Zealand in the recently-concluded Test series.

Pics: Bigg Boss OTT 3 Sana Sultan's 'dreamlike' nikah ceremony in MadinahSana Sultan, known from Bigg Boss OTT 3, married in a simple nikah ceremony in Madinah. Her Instagram post highlighted their journey, emphasising faith and simplicity over worldly glamour.

Short film Sunflowers Were the First Ones to Know qualifies for Oscar 2025Cannes-winning short film, Sunflowers Were the First Ones to Know, directed by FTII student Chidananda S Naik, has qualified for the 2025 Oscars in the Live Action Short Film category.
Rupali Ganguly greets paps with folded hands after stepdaughter's postsAmidst controversy from her stepdaughter Esha Verma, Rupali Ganguly recently greeted the paparazzi during a family outing.

Shahid Kapoor to Sharvari, celebs at Citadel Honey Bunny premiereThe blue carpet event of Prime Video's Citadel Honey Bunny was a starry affair. Shahid Kapoor, Sharvari, Arjun Kapoor, Aditya Roy Kapur, and others attended the show's premiere in Mumbai.

sports.headline: Happy Birthday Virat Kohli: Wishlist for 36-year-old superstarThe star of Indian cricket, Virat Kohli, is celebrating his 36th birthday. Here is a little wish-list for the batting maestro as he completes 365 days around the sun.

No one in New Zealand even dreamt of 3-0 win vs India: Will YoungWill Young, player of the series in IND vs NZ said that no one even dreamt of a whitewash when they arrived in India. Young, who put up consistent performances in the series said that the mood in the team is incredible after their historic feat.

Australia tour will decide the future of lot of players: Sunil GavaskarAustralia tour will decide the future of several Indian players including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, feels Sunil Gavaskar. The former cricketer felt that the captain and coach duo should be held responsible for the series loss vs New Zealand.

Gavaskar said that instead of Rohit, Jasprit Bumrah should be made the India captain for the entire series.
Virat Kohli gets Hanuman ji's poster by fan ahead of 36th birthday in MumbaiVirat Kohli received Hanuman ji's portrait from a fan at the Indian team's hotel in Mumbai.

New Zealand cricketers get warm reception after historic series win in IndiaNew Zealand cricket team got a rousing reception at their team hotel in Mumbai after their historic whitewash of India. The team put out the video of the celebration via their social media accounts.

Bastar Olympics 2024: 165,000 youth to participate across 11 sports disciplinesBastar Olympics 2024: The multi-sport event, announced by the Chattisgarh state government, aims to bridge the gap between the youth of Bastar and mainstream development, spotlighting local sports talent.

Vinesh Phogat hints at retirement U-turn with cryptic postWrestler-turned-politician Vinesh Phogat hinted at a retirement U-turn with a cryptic post on Instagram on Monday, 4 November. Vinesh had earlier announced her retirement in August after crashing out of Paris Olympics.

CSK will occasionally rest MS Dhoni to get best out of him in IPL 2025: PontingRicky Ponting suggested that CSK may rest MS Dhoni occasionally in IPL 2025 to maximise his impact. Despite stepping back from captaincy, Dhoni's experience, leadership, and finishing skills remain invaluable for the franchise's ambitions for a 6th title.

Gavaskar cites Tendulkar's 'preparation' example after India's series lossIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar gave Sachin Tendulkar's example and talked about the importance of preparing well before taking on quality bowlers at the international level.

Hazlewood wary of 'sleeping giant' India after whitewash vs New ZealandAustralia pacer Josh Hazlewood is wary of India, who have just been whitewashed at home by New Zealand. Hazlewood said that India's confidence would have taken a hit but they are a dangerous side.

Sunil Gavaskar exclusive: 'India should prepare pitches that help Bumrah at home'Speaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar said he was hurt by India's 0-3 defeat to New Zealand in a home Test series. Gavaskar reviewed Gautam Gambhir's coaching stint and opened up about the future of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the Test team.

Worst batting display at home in Tests by India? Sunil Gavaskar feels soSunil Gavaskar felt that this was one of India's worst batting displays at home in Test cricket. India suffered a 0-3 clean-sweep against New Zealand at home.

Gavaskar however believes that India should focus on winning BGT and not on reaching the WTC Final.

Mohammad Rizwan loses on ODI captaincy debut, but happy with Pakistan's MCG fightAustralia vs Pakistan, 1st ODI: Mohammad Rizwan praised the fighting effort of the visiting team despite losing the ODI series opener in Melbourne on Monday, November 4. Pakistan nearly defended a 203-run target.

Steve Smith fully prepared for Test series vs India: I can play tomorrowSenior Australia batter Steve Smith has said that he is fully ready for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India. Smith has said that he is in good form and has sorted out his technical issues.

History from brothers: Kane Williamson's congratulatory message for New ZealandKane Williamson shared a congratulatory post for the New Zealand team after their historic triumph on Indian soil. Williamson couldnt take part in the series due to groin injury.

Mitchell Starc was terrific at top: Pat Cummins hails bowlers for Australia's winPat Cummins was elated with his bowlers' performance in the 1st ODI between Australia and Pakistan. Australia won the 1st match by 2 wickets with Mitchell Starc being Player of the Match.

Women's Premier League finds new window in the updated Future Tour ProgrammeThe Women's Premier League (WPL) will now have a dedicated window in January-February starting from 2026, following changes in the women's Future Tours Programme for the 2025-29 cycle.

Sunil Gavaskar exclusive: 'Clock ticking for everybody, not just Virat and Rohit'Sunil Gavaskar Interview Live Updates: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar, speaking to India Today, reflected on India's 0-3 whitewash against New Zealand. From tactical blunders to Rohit Sharma's captaincy and Virat Kohli's form, the batting great spoke in length about the factors that led to humbling series loss.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
